lead_paragraph: The executive order, to take effect in 30 days, will prevent city managers from questioning job seekers or searching public records about previous salaries or benefits.

headline.print_headline: Mayor Tells Agencies to Stop Asking About Applicants’ Past Pay
headline.main: To Help Close Wage Gap, de Blasio Tells Agencies to Stop Asking About Applicants’ Past Pay

snippet: The executive order, to take effect in 30 days, will prevent city managers from questioning job seekers or searching public records about previous salaries or benefits....
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio signs executive order prohibiting city agencies from asking job applicants about previous salaries and benefits packages; order is effort by de Blasio administration to close wage gap for women and minorities who work for city.
